parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofp

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.21

</value></part><part><name>gr1 </name>=<value> Markers

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Set marker size.
Size is in format [a-axis, b-axis].
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature</title><part><name index="1"/><value>Informative</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>'''Multiplayer optimisation:''' Global marker commands always broadcast the ''entire'' marker state over the network. As such, the number of network messages exchanged when creating or editing a marker can be reduced by performing all but the last operation using local marker commands, then using a global marker command for the last change (and subsequent global broadcast of all changes applied to the marker).</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> markerName '''setMarkerSize''' [a-axis, b-axis]

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> markerName: [[String]]

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> [a-axis, b-axis]: [[Array]]

</value></part><part><name>p3</name>=<value> a-axis: [[Number]]. 1/2 width of marker

</value></part><part><name>p4</name>=<value> b-axis: [[Number]]. 1/2 height of marker

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]]
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>"MarkerOne" [[setMarkerSize]] [100, 200];</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[getMarkerSize]], [[setMarkerBrush]], [[setMarkerColor]], [[setMarkerDir]], [[setMarkerPos]], [[setMarkerShape]], [[createMarker]], [[setMarkerText]], [[setMarkerType]], [[setMarkerAlpha]]
</value></part></template>


[[Category:Scripting Commands OFP 1.99|<template><title>uc:<template><title>PAGENAME</title></template></title></template>]]
[[Category:Scripting Commands OFP 1.96|SETMARKERSIZE]]
